questions.question_text: What are two correct methods for creating a visual group? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Right-click a dimension in the Data pane
choices.B: Click the drop-down arrow from the top of the Data pane
choices.D: Drag a dimension onto another dimension in the Data pane

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
A. Right-click a dimension in the Data pane
C. Select marks in the view

Selected Answer: AC
AC is correct

Selected Answer: AC
AC correct tried

Selected Answer: C
Visual group unlike fields group, so the correct answer is C

Selected Answer: A
A. A measure

questions.question_text: What should you use to create an axis in a visualization?
To display data that has both negative and positive quantitative values, Tableau Desktop will display marks by using ________________________ as the default.

discussion.content: Ans C .Diverging palettes are most commonly used to show the difference between positive and negative numbers.
Answer is B. On the format menu, select workbook

Selected Answer: B
anser is B :)

Ans B .On the Format menu, select Workbook. The Format Workbook pane replaces the Data pane on the left and provides a series of drop-down lists where you can change all font settings in a workbook, as well as the font settings for titles of worksheets, stories, and dashboards.

choices.D: Select Format on the menu, and then select Title and Caption
choices.B: Select Format on the menu, and then select Workbook
choices.C: Select Help on the menu, and then select Settings and Performance
choices.A: Select Format on the menu, and then select Field Labels
